page.title: 02THE BRAES DISTILLERY
page.content: The American company, Chivas Brothers built this distillery in the 1970's. It is very mechanised with many processes controlled by the push of a button . As a result the workforce is small. The whisky is not stored on the premises but is transported in bulk tankers to the company's warehouses in Keith. The waste products, draff and pot ale are transported to the processing plant at Glenlivet. Recently the company became part of Seagrams, the Canadian consortium, and the distillery is run in conjunction with 'The Glenlivet' and the other company distilleries with management being moved freely throughout. Houses were built at the distillery for management and others closeby for the workforce. All the buildings blend in well with their surroundings.
